content:
I have finally completed the construction of the Fourier transform as a continuous linear equiv on Schwartz space, in #12144. It's way too big for a single PR, so I've already split 7 PRs out of it. Among these, the one that is the most blocking for further PRs is the short #12150, which I need to give an explicit definition of the iterated derivative of multilinear maps (bounds on derivatives of multilinear maps are useful to derive explicit estimates on derivatives of the Fourier transform of a Schwartz function).

Note that #12150 encounters issues with typeclass inference around complicated spaces of continuous linear maps, an issue that we have already met several times. I have a silly workaround (register the problematic instance in a specific def, and activate it as a local instance where needed), but if anyone (@Matthew Ballard ?) has better ideas, I'm all ears!
I can take a look but it might be later today. Something bad seems to have happened at O’Hare so my flight is visiting South Bend at the moment
My guess is it's the same as https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/nested.20linear.20map.20norm.20failure/near/423226292
I made an issue lean#3927 since there is a TODO in the code explicitly referencing a configuration option for this. At the least this gives a unified tracker to synthPendingDepth failures
Otherwise I think its a :peace_sign:

Thanks! I don't have a mathlib-free #mwe to add to the issue, unfortunately (I tried to create one by mimicking part of the normed space / module / linear maps hierarchy, but it was probably too simplified because the issue didn't show up there).
I added the references (and explanations) to OperatorNorm files in #12188.

May I ping on the series of PRs leading to the Fourier transform on Schwartz space in #12144? The current blocking PRs are #12207, which introduces the iterated derivative of a multilinear map (as a formal definition -- the fact that it's indeed the iterated derivative will be proved in a forthcoming PR), and #11937 (giving integration by parts along a given direction in finite-dimensional real vector spaces).
I left some comments on #12207. It's marked as failing CI, but that seems to be the "broken pipe" CI error from earlier today
